choices.name: Get started with research for your Vermont ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Vermont ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Selection Table to determine priorities for Vermont research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Vermont research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Vermont Research Tips and Strategies
    ☆ AA—Vermont Genealogy

  2. Follow this research study for Vermont ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Vermont Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Vermont research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Vermont Resources
    ☆ AC—Vermont State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Vermont Record Selection Table to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Vermont Record Selection Table

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Early Settlers: Watch this video to learn about Vermont settlers before 1784.

      ☆ AA—Early Vermont Settlers to 1784 Study Project—61:45




    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Vermont in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Vermont
      ☆ FS—Wiki: Vermont Minorities

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—Vermont African American Records

    3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Vermont in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Vermont


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Early Settlers: Watch this video to learn about Vermont settlers before 1784.

    ☆ AA—Early Vermont Settlers to 1784 Study Project—61:45

  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Vermont in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Vermont
    ☆ FS—Wiki: Vermont Minorities

  3. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Vermont in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Vermont

1. Explore Vermont historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Vermont History

  2. Explore Vermont history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Vermont

  3. Learn about Vermont history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Vermont History

choices.name: Learn about Vermont archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Vermont archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Vermont Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Virginia State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Watch this video to learn about resources available in Vermont archives.

    ☆ AAC—Hidden Gems in Green Mountain Repositories—4:22

  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Vermont.
  4. Explore the Vermont State Archives collection.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Vermont genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Vermont research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Vermont ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Vermont city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Vermont Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Vermont city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Vermont city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Vermont ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Vermont city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Vermont County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Vermont.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Vermont Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Vermont Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Vermont Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. Northeast Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Vermont.

Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Vermont research.
  2. Explore the Vermont research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Vermont research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Vermont in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Vermont Societies

  2. Explore the Vermont French-Canadian Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Vermont Historical Society Library site.
  4. Explore the Genealogical Society of Vermont site.
  5. Explore Vermont genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in Vermont.
